head.title: More Shock Waves Over the Mideast

hedline.hl1: More Shock Waves Over the Mideast

abstract.p: Jerry Rapp letter disputes Oct 3 editorial describing Ariel Sharon's visit to Temple Mount in Jerusalem as 'provocative and irresponsible'; questions why a Jew cannot visit Temple Mount, or for that matter, any place else in Jerusalem

block.p: Re ''Conflagration in the Middle East'' (editorial, Oct. 3): You describe Ariel Sharon's visit to the Temple Mount in Jerusalem as ''provocative and irresponsible.''
Re ''Conflagration in the Middle East'' (editorial, Oct. 3): You describe Ariel Sharon's visit to the Temple Mount in Jerusalem as ''provocative and irresponsible.''

While Mr. Sharon certainly had political motives for making such a visit at the time he did, we ought not to forget that the basic rationale underlying the founding of the state of Israel was to give Jews the right to go wherever they wanted, whenever they wanted, in a country of their own -- a far cry from what Jews almost anywhere on this planet had experienced in the previous two millenniums or so.
One must wonder when it will be all right, from the Arab perspective, for a Jew to visit the Temple Mount or, for that matter, anywhere else in Jerusalem.
